channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Mountain bikers disregarding rubbish, 5th July
item.description:
Cyclists/mountain bike riders have built jumps in the park in two locations drawing in a crowd of teenagers on a daily basis ( this is not my issue ) my issue is that they are constantly leaving piles and piles of rubbish behind , sweet packets , drink bottles just thrown on the floor or into the bushes. I fill a carrier bag most mornings cleaning it up in both locations. I feel im in a loosing battle. I think its time to remove this jumps on the paths to stop enticing them to litter so disrespectfully its very important we look after out green spaces so people like myself who dont litter can enjoy them as well as the abundance of wildlife we share the park with. The areas are located on the stone park avenue wood side of the park close to the green within the woods.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Manor Way, Eden Park, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Rubbish dumping, 5th July
item.description:
Dumping activities has increased within these month,various stuff like door panel,woods,cardboard,boxes.and shopping trolleys ,buggy.please need to be short it out.thanks.my suspicious is these are done by travellers which I spotted a lot of them around Woolwich common and broad walk area

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 373, Rochester Way, Well Hall, London

item.title: Littering, 5th July
item.description:
There is a major littering problem outside the Scolt Head which is always worse at the weekends. The bin is either over flowing or trash is left on the streets. Today’s it’s multiple pizza boxes. This is every week. Please do something about it?

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Englefield Road, Hackney, London

item.title: Overgrown trees covering bus stop flag and shelter, 5th July
item.description:
Trees in the grounds of Bonser House are overgrown and covering the bus stop flag at bus stop V. Please can these be trimmed at your earliest convenience?

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 70-74, Stewarts Road, London

item.title: Fly tipping, 5th July
item.description:

item.title: Lime bikes - Chronic parking problem, 5th July
item.description:
1-9 Shrubland has become a default parking lot for Lime bikes. Please work with Lime to make it stop. After erecting an informal barrier and posting a sign, parking on residential grounds continues and too many bikes are blocking the pavement.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Shrubland Road, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Fly tipping needs collected, 5th July
item.description:
Fly tipping in backlands was never fully removed after reported in May and June. A resident moved all rubbish from there (rubble, green waste, plastics, electricals) up to the street for easier Council collection. It's in front of 11-13.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Shrubland Road, Hackney, London
